theoryTitle: Davy Back Fight Will Decide the Pirate King
theoryText: The Long Ring Long Land arc may set up the ending of One Piece, with the Straw Hats competing against the Red Hair Pirates in a Davy Back Fight callback. Since proper combat between Luffy and Shanks is unlikely due to their relationship, a Davy Back Fight could serve as a friendly competition to determine who becomes Pirate King.
author: Multiple One Piece theorists
supportingEvidence: Shanks has been shown to value friendship and fair competition
Recent manga developments (Chapter 1155) reveal Rocks D. Xebec used Davy Back Fights to build his crew
The arc's seemingly 'pointless' nature suggests future importance per Oda's foreshadowing style
counterEvidence: Shanks may simply acknowledge Luffy as Pirate King without competition
The final conflict is more likely against Blackbeard
communityReception: Increasingly popular theory gaining traction in 2023-2025
relatedTheories: Blackbeard will challenge Luffy to a Davy Back Fight
The final war will involve Davy Back Fight rules

theoryTitle: Long Ring Long Land Arc Foreshadows Final Saga Events
theoryText: Recent manga developments reveal that Rocks D. Xebec admired Davy Jones and frequently participated in Davy Back Fights to expand his crew. This connection suggests the Long Ring Long Land arc was laying groundwork for major reveals about pirate history and the final conflict.
author: One Piece community (post-Chapter 1155)
supportingEvidence: Chapter 1155 explicitly connects Rocks to Davy Back Fights
The arc introduced the concept that will pay off decades later
Oda rarely includes content without future purpose
counterEvidence: Could be coincidental worldbuilding rather than direct foreshadowing
The anime filler portions are unlikely to be relevant
communityReception: Widely accepted after Chapter 1155 revelations vindicated the arc's importance
relatedTheories: Davy Jones will be revealed as a historical figure in One Piece
The Davy Back Fight has deeper lore significance

theoryTitle: Long Ring Long Land's Regular Flooding Foreshadows Global Flooding
theoryText: The unique geography of Long Ring Long Land, with its regular tidal flooding patterns, may foreshadow the series' eventual revelation about rising sea levels and the sinking of the world. The island's adaptation to cyclical flooding could represent how the world once dealt with similar conditions.
author: One Piece theorists
supportingEvidence: Recent manga chapters reveal global sea level rising
The island's geography serves no other narrative purpose
Oda frequently uses environmental storytelling for foreshadowing
counterEvidence: Could simply be unique worldbuilding for this specific island
The flooding mechanism differs from what's revealed later in the manga
communityReception: Moderate support, seen as possible but not definitive
relatedTheories: The Ancient Kingdom knew how to survive flooding
Long Ring Long Land is an Ancient Kingdom remnant
